headline: Ask HN: Dropbox uses Python a lot, is it also the case for their Windows client?
description:
It is well known that Dropbox uses (or used) Python a lot for their operation - I have read this quite often here on HN or elsewhere. I imagine this is true for their backend servers.

Question: is or was their Windows client app (the one which stays in the bottom-right system tray icon notification area near the clock, has a GUI, and watches the filesystem for changes) mainly done in Python too?

If so, which py => exe freeze solution did they use?

How did they prevent the Python bytecode to be decompiled (obfuscation, or compilation in a similar way to Cython? another method?)

Did they open-source some of the tools they developed to make Python perform well as a language that can be distributed as a .exe?

I have tried py2exe and many similar tools, also Cython in embedded mode, and distribution as a .exe is usually not the strength of Python (usual tools work rather well, but sooner or later you find corner cases), so I am curious about the Dropbox company tools for this.

Are there articles about this?
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: Dropbox经常使用Python，他们的Windows客户端也是这样吗？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: Dropbox經常使用Python，他們的Windows客戶端也是這樣嗎？
description_zh-Hans:
众所周知，Dropbox在其运作中大量使用（或使用）Python--我在HN或其他地方经常读到这一点。

问题：他们的Windows客户端应用程序（停留在右下角系统托盘图标通知区，靠近时钟，有一个GUI，并观察文件系统的变化）是否也主要由Python完成？

如果是，他们使用了哪种py => exe冻结解决方案？

他们是否开源了一些他们开发的工具，以使Python作为一种可以作为.exe发布的语言表现良好？

我试过py2exe和许多类似的工具，也试过嵌入式模式的Cython，作为.exe发布通常不是Python的优势（通常的工具工作得相当好，但你迟早会发现角落的情况），所以我对Dropbox公司在这方面的工具很好奇。
description_zh-Hant:
眾所周知，Dropbox在其運作中大量使用（或使用）Python--我在HN或其他地方經常讀到這一點。

問題：他們的Windows客戶端應用程序（停留在右下角系統托盤圖標通知區，靠近時鐘，有一個GUI，並觀察文件系統的變化）是否也主要由Python完成？

如果是，他們使用了哪種py => exe凍結解決方案？

他們是否開源了一些他們開發的工具，以使Python作為一種可以作為.exe發佈的語言表現良好？

我試過py2exe和許多類似的工具，也試過嵌入式模式的Cython，作為.exe發佈通常不是Python的優勢（通常的工具工作得相當好，但你遲早會發現角落的情況），所以我對Dropbox公司在這方面的工具很好奇。
